title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: After applying it took about one week to hear back regarding an interview. There were two interviews. The first interview was with other advisors, and the second was with other individuals from the department/school. Both interviews took place online.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your professional career.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: One Zoom interview with three people and one in person interview that is just going over the role again and confirming employment. The Zoom was about 30 minutes of basic interview questions as well as more pinted ones regarding interacting in an educational environment,
Interview Questions: How would you treat professors vs. students

title: contact tracer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an easy process and took a week to respond once I submitted my application. The questions were typical of any job interview asking if qualifications and experience related to the role applied.
Interview Questions: They asked what were my qaukifications

title: Senior Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were condescending and extremely invasive. The interview did not feel comfortable, or organized. Sat through questioning about my portfolio and credentials, only to be rushed into taking an offer at the bottom of the salary range.
Interview Questions: Would you say you’re more of a quantitative or qualitative researcher?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was easy-going and personable. Interview was straightforward and asked relevant questions. Was offered the job immediately after. It was very nice not to have to wait to find out!
Interview Questions: What was my experience with research?

title: Maths Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Good. It was good as I was also interested in teaching. I like teaching students and help the students in achieving their goals. I am very happy to work with them and help students as well.
Interview Questions: How much good are you in conducting classes?

title: Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick, to the point, easy going. Team leads or operation managers asked reasonable question to note interest in position as well as openness to other possible positions. Willing to answer questions I had as the interviewee.
Interview Questions: What would be able to bring to the team that can be used in future event?

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews. The first was a 30 minute phone screening consisting of standard interview questions and others assessing clinical skills. The second was in person and was a half-day. Met first with search committee, then entire department followed be a prepared case presentation. Several staff then took you to lunch and the day ended with a one-on-one with the director.
Interview Questions: What I did for self care.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a few different open positions, most were immediate rejections in positions which were less than basic qualifications. Some were open, and waited two+ months for any word. It seems impossible to get an actual interview here.
Interview Questions: Never got this far! No one I know gets this far.

title: Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Large group interviewing by Zoom. Mostly former journalism backgrounds. They relied on boilerplate get to know you questions...behavioral, I guess. "Tell me about a time....". It was fine, but it didn't feel like they really were interested in filling the position as maybe confirming their existing views. That could be a bad read, but that's how it felt. The questions were passed around from different people. Some seemed more comfortable with the material or more engaged with the process than others. There may have been other work going on another screen. I don't know if I can put 30 words out on this as it is not all that fresh in my memory as I sit here and write this note.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you led a Diversity Initiative.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: It Was good, the process is easy to follow and straightforward. The interviewer and HR explained everything without hesitation. Overall, It was a wonderful experience with Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis.
Interview Questions: Basic Demographics and subject related.

title: GIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interview with a presentation was hectic. But the people asked important questions on subject matter. However Didn’t seem very friendly so I chose not to get in. Also no remote position available.
Interview Questions: 1. What are your Career goals 2. Why did you chose to do this masters thesis?

title: CRT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy, they will hire anyone with motive to strive or get a further education. Just make sure to be genuinely curious and knowledgeable about what you would be doing. Make sure to do some research on the study as well as the company.
Interview Questions: What’s your background? Why do you want this job?

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interviews. 2 people interviewed me then I was called in for an offer for the position. questions were asked about my experience and grad school plans. what I would want to do to expand the role and add to the program
Interview Questions: How would you left a mark as the Graduate Assistant before you leave the position

title: Director of Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Initial zoom meeting with a panel of internal stakeholders, behavioral questions. Second round was a presentation and a few specific questions. It was straight forward, however the process was a bit vague. Canned rejection email.
Interview Questions: What would you do in your first 30 days in this role?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I simply had a one-on-one online interview. And then I was called back and offered a job. Standard interview questions, but maybe it is different because the PI was the interviewer and not a representative of the school.
Interview Questions: What my expectations were from the job.

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was a lot of people in the interview. I had to complete a case presentation and and respond to basic counseling practice questions. I was most nervous about the case presentation.
Interview Questions: What is your approach to counseling.

title: Undergraduate Math Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very good. The interview was conducted in a very professional manner and the interviewing panel seemed very knowledgeable and experienced. Started off with questions like why I want the position transitioning into my skillset, moving into a skill and knowledge assessment.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Campus Health Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview over zoom with clinic manager, direct supervisors, and business manager. Overall, lots of open ended questions and conversation-style dialog. They are friendly and laid back. They really want to get to know you during your interview.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with HIPAA?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: A short phone interview with an in person interview, and if they like you and want to offer you the position then the normal process ensues with working with children. Drug screen, TB test, etc
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses? How long have you worked with children?

title: Assistant Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a basic phone interview with HR, and lasted about 30 minutes.  Second interview, over Zoom, was with a panel of 4 faculty and 1 HR rep, none of which you would work for.  Second interview was less than an hour.
Interview Questions:
Describe yourself.
They asked about fundraising experience and we’re looking for a good fit and not necessarily exact experience match.

title: Program Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 4 people. It felt as if they wanted someone with the exact experience as the job specs. They were not flexible with the job requirements
Interview Questions: They were very many questions . One question was describe a time you had to collaborate with a group of people

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: After reviewing my resume, the professor in charge asked me for a one to one technical interview. It was basically a discussion of where my interests are. It was very helpful for me as well as IUPUI
Interview Questions: What field are you trying to concentrate majorly on?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews total, one on the phone, two over Zoom: one with the hiring manager and one with the rest of the staff. It was fairly normal questions, mostly looking at what my passions were and how I would fit in with the job.
Interview Questions: Why would I be the best fit for this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about the concepts related to the subject. Gave problems to solve to test my knowledge in the subject. Asked how many hours am I available to work per week.
Interview Questions: Application of derivatives and integration formulae?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview not required. They will ask to submit an employment form. Based on it, they will select students. So, no interview is required. Just we need to upload our resumes.
Interview Questions: No questions. Need to submit resume

title: International Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then received interview email 2-3 weeks later. I schedule the interview, and then attended it about a week later. Different time slots were offered and  I selected the ones that worked best with my school schedule.
Interview Questions: Most questions were the classic behavioral questions eg: what are your strengths/weaknesses

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in the School of Engineering and Technology.   They were very professional, kind, and timely.  I appreciated their candor and attention to detail during the entire process.
Interview Questions: They asked me my experience with URM (Underrepresented Minority) population.

title: Academic Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was calm, the interviewers were friendly, they seemed supportive and were intrested in knowing about the candidates. The staff is experienced and have been there for a long time. They are really passionate about the office and want to hire people who would actually make a difference and contribute to the mission of the  University.
Interview Questions: Tell Me About a Time You Had to Solve a Challenging Problem.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interview, they asked a couple of questions.  Then assigned me some tasks to design an email template.  They gave me one week.  After that,  I presented my design to them.
Interview Questions: What if you and your teammates have different ideas?

title: Technical Support Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Super easy, if  not a little informal. You interview with two SA's in one of the conference rooms. Just be prepared for any troubleshooting scenario they give you... with that said, you don't need to know a whole lot when you come in. They train you and they always need people.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone called in saying the remote for their TV wasn't working?

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point . Managers were very nice and they want to see how wise of a person you are.  Interview was more laid back and asked about you personally and what other hobbies you might be interested in.
Interview Questions: Are you able to be quiet for a prolonged time

title: Testing Center Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 management member asks you questions while the other 2 management members assess and write down your answers, after the interview all 3 members congregate and discuss and send out an email to let you know if they would like to move forward or not.
Interview Questions: what would you do if a student was being unreasonable

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to come to the office. You do not have to wear formal dress because they know that you are a student. 
Interview questions are not really difficult to answers and the interviewer is the supervisor for the job. The interviewer asked me three questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience about the job that you are applying?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two day interview with presentation to illustrate your teaching pedagogy. Dinner the night before interview with search committee. Meeting with the dean, chair and students. Tour of the campus and conversation about next steps.
Interview Questions: There really weren't any unexpected questions that I can remember. That the students did their research on me before our meeting and so their questions were great. You are being interviewed from the moment you accept the interview over the phone.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Good relation with the professor for a semester should be enough to request this position. No interview required as such. Performing well in their course can make you trustworthy in their eyes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was all about self introduction and part of behavioral interview,  in which the interviewer gives you a specific role and asks you for your views and challenges you might face in that role
Interview Questions: basic introduction and behavioral

title: Computer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying I received an email to let me choose from some times they would be available to interview me. In the interview, there was one person in the room and another joining through video bridge. It took 2 weeks for me to hear back. The let me know through email that I got the job and if I would like to accept their offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you are the only person in the support center and you have someone on the phone asking for a supervisor and a person at walk-up asking for a supervisor.

title: K103 Mentoring Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward behavioral interview. They're interested in finding students that have done well in course and are extremely relatable. You'll likely have to give a mock lesson, and they'll ask you typical strength/weakness questions.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest strengths/weaknesses?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with principle investigator, very nice man, easy-going. A single one on one interview where he asked about academic background and career interests. Talked about what classes had been taken, what I wanted to get out of research, and where I saw my career going after graduation
Interview Questions: What is your interest in microbiology?

title: Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a group of about six people, including the Dean of the school and members of the school's leadership team.  They went around the table and each asked me a couple questions.  I also shared samples of my work and described the strategy behind the samples. A few weeks after the group interview I was invited to have a one-on-one interview with the Dean.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my experience and how I would handle specific goals.

title: Grant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had two face to face interviews,  both were split into two sessions, with various people from HR and the program. The last interview was with the Chief Operating Officer. Most of the questions were on my background and some were behavioral. Atmosphere was relaxed even though there were 6 people interviewing at once. After 2 face to face interview I got an offer over the phone.
Interview Questions: Mostly they asked about my experience but there were some personality questions like - what are your top three strengths? Also what would your boss say about you? What kind of team do you work on currently?  Ended interview with some more off the wall questions like "what would you do if you won the lottery".

title: Proctor - Testing Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Currently, the department only hires part time help, which means no benefits.  There was an assistant and then a department head who spoke to me.  The interview was casual and did not consist of the typical interview questions. Be advised that you do not receive a set schedule of 20 hours in the position.  It varies from week to week.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with not having a fixed schedule and coming in sometimes at 6:30 a.m?

title: Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: The process was great and simple for someone who has not had any experience in the job world before. It is an excellent place to start. There is just one small on-site interview and it is all behavioral. It is make sure that they are hiring someone who has potential and willingness to learn and listen.
Interview Questions: Give me 3 strengths and weaknesses about you

title: Student Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 professors asked general questions of what I have done at school and where I wanted to go. It was semi informal since most of the professors already knew me from other activities
Interview Questions: Questions were broad open ended.

title: Energy Auditor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Technical Question, Ethic question, took 20 mins and held in their office. 3 interviewers asked me questions about my background , my resume and why I am interested to work in IAC. I should say technical questions were pretty much easy for me to answer.
Interview Questions: kW, kWh, cfm, energy saving methods, ethic questions

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by a panel of current staff, three in all. All were very friendly and represented their company culture as open and collaborative. The interview lasted a little longer than an hour and included a session of question and answer as well as a resume review. During the resume review, I was provided with a sample student resume and asked to lead a mock session to provide feedback regarding the resume.
Interview Questions: What are two positive quality traits that you currently do not have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, easy and painless. One interview with a real person and another over the phone. Things took a while to move from application to interview but much faster once interview was complete.
Interview Questions: What are my hobbies?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview and 2 face-to-face interviews.  After the phone screen, it was almost 2 weeks later when I got the initial face-to-face interview.  This was a panel interview with 4 people from the department. The 2nd in-person interview was with the CFO and Associate Director.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Assistant Director of Recruitment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with group of counselors, had to give a mock admissions presentation.  Was called back for 2nd interview with VP and the Director.  They process too about 2-3 weeks after the position was closed.  Most communication happened by email.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know a lot about my ideas to encourage students to live on a campus that's mostly a commuter college.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to my soon-to-be supervisor via email initially. We had been connected by professors and staff in my program. We set up a time to speak on the phone. A few days after our conversation, I was told that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to create syntax in SPSS?

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to the research facility by a professor, and emailed them for information. I was invited to come speak with the other researchers at the center.I had a brief conversation with other employees who operate the facility, without necessarily looking for a job, and was emailed approximately 2 months later with a job offer. Very straightforward, no cheesy interview questions or personality testing, and no drug screening. A background check was performed.
Interview Questions: Informal interview; no questions. They asked about my research interests.

title: Summer Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: One interview with two resident coordinators.  I was in a room of five table each had different housing staff.  The interview last 20 minutes and asked basic questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for IUPUI?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: they just ask u typical behavior questions and ask you to answer accordingly and specefiy each answer as to why ur doing this or that yeah and u have to be very energetic and good at talking and discussing just aswer behavioral questions such as why u want this n why u want that u know
Interview Questions: just aswer behavioral questions such as why u want this n why u want that u know

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview with interview panel. They went around the table asking different types of questions pertaining to personal traits and specific job questions. Took about 30 minutes to complete. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: What are 5 things you could do with a news paper?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mostly Behavior questions. Like teamwork and such. They asked questions related to your background too. Basically they just went over your resume and asked you to talk about your experience
Interview Questions: Q: what's your plan about your job

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phd student to assist in her lab. There was one very informal interview. The process was slow but easy. There were no technical questions, only do you know about ... I remember being asked about Java, Python, and MySQL. I was hired on the spot. After the interview, my application was processed by the university. They added me to payroll, did a background check and drug test, and gave me a key card for the lab. The whole process took over a month after the interview.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application and was contacted in April to interview for a position next fall semester.  Interview consisted of a written test and a presentation.  They allow you to retake the test up to 3 times.  After the test, I was given a list of problems to choose one and then 5 minutes to prepare.  I then presented the problem to the managers as if they were students and answered their questions.  This was comparatively easy to the written exam.
Interview Questions: The C2 evaluation was difficult.  I scored a 51% initially, and had to retake it to score in the 70th percentile.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: It is quite simple. You have to have a grade point average B and above to be consider as a grader. As long as the opening position for it, you should get the job. There is no intense interview for this job position. Just a few minute talk with the professor will work.
Interview Questions: When did you take this class?

title: Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and informal
Interview Questions: All very standard

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sit at a round table with other supervisors that have an opening, and discuss what openings are available and understand the candidate.  It takes around 30 minutes to do the interview, if you get accepted, they will call you and let you know.
Interview Questions: Are you able to perform the job functions?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: submit application through the human resources website, just one interview with supervisor. offer position and explain benefits and compensatin
Interview Questions: what is the most difficult situation you have ever dealt with while working?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions:
The lab manager called me and said they are very impressed with me. but they said they need some who will work together not just know the techniques. I told I was excellent in that.

They already gave the Job to someone and just conducting interviews for formality,,,,Over all 1/2 hour of my time was wasted.
Interview Questions: No very easy

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 in person interviews , one with the director the second with the team. Final interview was a presentation in front of a panel of people. Took a long time to move through the process.
Interview Questions: Provided a scenario that I used to create a PP presnetation

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit application to the school by February to be considered for fall semester openings. Assistantships last one year. Professors choose their own candidates, and do their own interviews. In my experience, a professor gets recommended a student. If a professor or school director contacts you, then you’re basically hired. The interview is just a formality.
Interview Questions: What research areas are you interested in? Do you want a PhD?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at IUPUI
Interview Descriptions: few Face 2 face interviews
Interview Questions: Details question of my area of research

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The Interview Process consisted of basic questions regarding  your Resume, your experience as a Custodian, and scnerio questions. The process consists of a group/panel interview with four supervisors and one building operator manager.
Interview Questions: If you and your team leader had to complete a project of strip and waxing a long hallway of a building and you had to complete your regular tasks for your designated area, which tasks should be done first?

title: Patient Services Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview on a Friday and was told that they would contact me either next Thursday or Friday.  Never heard from them.  Sent a thank you email and also sent another email wondering what was going on with the selection and received no reply's. I wouldn't want to work for a company that doesn't have the courtesy to reply to emails or follow up like promised.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current position

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: When I turned in my completed application, the head of the program set up an interview with me for the next day. I was interviewed by the two program heads. They were very personable and it was more of like a conversation. I made the mistake of not reviewing my resume beforehand and so I was unable to answer a couple of questions like I wanted to. This was my third interview with IUPUI (I have had more than one campus job) and it is always different but you will learn something from each one. I was notified within one week of their decision in the form of a mailed letter.
Interview Questions: They asked me what I live my by.

title: UITS Support Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: 3 Emails, 2 separate Interviews, 1 Skills Test
Interview Questions:
What do you know about computers? Here's a scenario..... what would you do? 
Here's another scenario..... what would you do?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: talk to PI for an hour tour of lab.  very easy questions.  mostly looked at resume and asked question about it.  asked about past work experiences related to job.  where want to be in 5 years and how I plan to get there.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at IUPUI (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Meet with PI/Post-doc and see if you're a good fit for the lab.
Interview Questions: N/A
